page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS- BALLIFIELD
page.content: In the Ballifield Middle School area the results of questionnaires to local residents revealed the following information. Many people were primarily concerned with the problem of local unemployment. Some expressed concern about the extremist policies of the local council, accusing them of bad management and of demanding excessively high rates. Worries were also expressed about today's youth - about their attitudes and unsociable behaviour. Increasing vandalism was mentioned along with concern about the lack of local facilities for teenagers. Some parents expressed fears about the busy local roads and were particularly worried about the Rotherham and Retford Road junction.
